I learned a lot from field trips.

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  Thomas Kwan. Please note that my following responses are regarding Amanda (who was assigned as my group's TA), not Thomas.
Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  Thomas Kwan.
Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  Amanda Loundsbury
Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  The TA for my team was Amanda.
Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  Amanda
Instructor: Sheena Shiyi Zhang  Sheena Zhang.
Instructor: Sheena Shiyi Zhang  Sheena Zhang
Instructor: Sheena Shiyi Zhang  Thomas Kwan
Instructor: Sheena Shiyi Zhang  Sheena

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  Amanda was usually pretty responsive to emails. However, my group was a bit frustrated by her seeming lack of understanding of our project idea.
Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  Thomas is very responsive and most of the time he is helpful.
Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  A little spacey and seemed really preoccupied with her own work. We often felt like we were on a different page with her.

Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  To the previous question: Amanda is not necessarily the most organized person, although she was very accessible. She was very busy through the semester and was not particularly engaged in the work process of the team. Anytime though when asked for feedback and guidance, Amanda was ready to help.
Instructor: Amanda Winston Lounsbury  She was always responsive and helpful. Could have maybe been more involved in the earlier portions of the project when we were getting everything set up.
Instructor: Sheena Shiyi Zhang  Sheena was very encouraging and helpful throughout the semester. She answered emails promptly and fulfilled our requests happily.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: project and collaboration based
Having access to the CEID and learning all of the cool things it has to offer!
Having access to CEID and all of the tools there.
Constructed group work; prototyping and design process practice and learning

Hands-on experimentation - it's the only class at Yale that I've taken where we actually DO things instead of just talk about the theory behind how/what one should do in the real world. A lot of fun and great exposure to a lot of different areas within green engineering.

The gaming part of the course and the interactive classes taught a lot of concepts hands-on without being too heavy. The challenges also posed a real problem that should be solved through the tools of design and entreprenuerhsip. Most of all I liked the idea that in this class we had to embrace all sustainability frameworks and put them to practice.
The hands on building and the few classes where we did fun exercises.
Working with Larry to build the prototype.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: organization of lectures, flow of content, better hands on learning

I think there is a lot of unnecessary busy work in the course that just took up time and did not really provide much educational benefit. The incredibly long homework assignments in which we basically restated material from the readings is one example. Another is having to produce 12 identical "1 pagers" for the judges which did not have much educational value. Having undergrads and graduate students in the same course felt strange. As a grad student, I felt as if I were being "babied" sometimes as there as a lot of oversight and hand holding from the professors and TAs.

Homework problem sets were FAR too long and arduous - I didn't feel like it was a valuable use of time as many times the questions just required you to regurgitate material in the book or lecture (like a high school homework set) -- it would have been better to make students do more analysis (or nothing at all).

More interaction between the TA and the student teams, as well as shorter challenge goals. The homeworks were not adequate to the learning of the graduate students. The questions required lengthy responses without actual application of the learnt material.

There was far too much lecture on subjects that only tangentially had to do with our projects. The class at times felt like a low-level undergraduate or even high school class, with the problem sets basically just being busy work. We should have started building and prototyping and designing much earlier, with less lectures that most people aren't even listening to and don't really effect the coursework.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: On the right track but needs refining.
The class involved a lot of discussions and I liked that.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The class will probably better suit people with some science and engineering background, since the focus is on product development and prototypes. I have no background in these two and struggled with taking part in prototyping.
I'm all about innovation, so this course was interesting. Much of the lectures didn't really have to do with innovation though.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I better understand and utilize the design process and how it can contribute to sustainability.
I wanted to design green products and also run through the process of a start up idea.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: no
Yes! I learned a lot.
Yes, for the most part.
more than i had expected
Merely.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: diverse, as both an advantage and disadvantage

The class hinges on group work, so knowing how to be a team player is imperative. Unfortunately, one of my team members failed to pull his weight time and time again, which was extremely frustrating. The rest of the team was outstanding, though.

The advantage is that I was able to learn from my teammates and we were able to bounce ideas off each other. The disadvantage is that not everyone in the group contributed equally. It is frustrating when two of your team mates do little to no work leaving you to pull their weight. Having peer evaluations as a warning was perhaps a bit helpful to motivate them to do work, but still did not truly alleviate the problem.
I had a great group!

The entire semester I worked with a team. The advantages were to share the work and the exchange ideas and perspectives. The disadvantages were the disagreement and sometimes bad time management towards deliverables.
Tough to get everyone on the same page. Some people not working as hard as others. Good to share the workload though. Have to deal with the domineering personalities.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: only if you really want to use the CEID and have no prior exposure to the design process

Take the course if you are able to devote substantial time to a semester long project. Also, this course is incredibly group based so you will have a miserable time if you don't like working with other people.
This is a very hands-on course, which can be great or frustrating, especially depending on your team.
get the group organized early on; delegate responsibilities; don't procrastinate
Worthwhile if you are willing to put the time/energy into it.

The class is interesting and interactive, provides a different approach to sustaianbility problems. It also teaches important concepts of design. Depending on the end-semester challenge, towards the end there might not be a lot of learning involved, since for example somoene needs to make a PowerPoint or a customer survey. Overall, an interesting class that can lead towards an interesting story for the resume, along with skills. Besides, the CEID is a very nice space to hang out.
Don't take it too seriously.
